thread.title: Daytona NASCAR Trucks Race Ends Just Like It Started: With A Huge Wreck
thread.title_full: Daytona NASCAR Trucks Race Ends Just Like It Started: With A Huge Wreck

author: Stef Schrader on Black Flag, shared by Stef Schrader to Jalopnik
title: Daytona NASCAR Trucks Race Ends Just Like It Started: With A Huge Wreck
text:
GIF via FS1 
Matt Crafton was leading tonight’s NASCAR Camping World Truck Series race until a last-lap crash sent him flying through the air, letting Kaz Grala through to win the race. Eighteen-year-old Grala now becomes the youngest winner ever at Daytona in any of NASCAR’s national series. 
Ben Rhodes lost control of his truck as what was left of tonight’s race traffic went three-wide on the last lap, sending his truck into Crafton’s at the front of the pack as it approached the checkered flag. Advertisement Advertisement 
Ouch. 
The race restarted with only three laps to go after John Hunter Nemechek spun out on lap 95 of the 100-lap race. Sponsored 
Rookie Grala is so young and new at this, he claimed that he didn’t know what to do to celebrate—including not knowing how to do a donut. His radio cord also came loose on lap 79, leaving him without any kind of spotter information at one of NASCAR’s most chaotic venues until the cord connection jiggled back into place at the very end of the race. Daytona Truck NASCARnage
